name: A Tribute to the Ramones Quiz | Music | 10 Questions

questions.text: All of the band members over the years had the 'Ramones' monicker as their stagename, and Johnny was no different. What was his real name?
questions.explanation:
John Cummings.

	Johnny was born on 8th October, 1948, in Long Island, New York. Johnny played with the band from their debut album, right through to their final release.

questions.text: Johnny wasn't the first of the Ramones to pass away. Which of these was?
questions.explanation:
Joey.

	Singer Joey Ramone, aka Jeffrey Hyman, died in 2001 from lymphatic cancer. Just a year later the band's bassist, Dee Dee, died from a drug overdose.

questions.text: Which of the following was the title of the first Ramones album?
questions.explanation:
Ramones.

	Their self-titled debut album included tracks such as "Blitzkrieg Bop", "Judy is a Punk", and "53rd & 3rd". The Ramones would go on to make 14 studio albums in their career.

questions.text: In 2003, a tribute album to the Ramones was released with rock performers from all genres playing Ramones songs. Which of these sang "Do you Remember Rock 'N' Roll Radio"?
questions.explanation:
Kiss.

	All of these bands featured on the CD, which also included tracks from Tom Waits, Rob Zombie, The Offspring, Green Day and others.

questions.text: Who was the bass player on the band's farewell CD, "Adios Amigos"?
questions.explanation:
C.J.

	The CD was released in 1994, with C.J. on bass, Marky on drums, Joey on vocals, and Johnny on guitar. Following the release of the CD, the band became the first in history to play two tracks, live and back-to-back, on British pop show "Top of the Pops".

questions.text: Which of these is NOT a Ramones song?
questions.explanation:
I Wanna Eat Some Food.

	"We Want the Airwaves" was on the 1981 album, "Pleasant Dreams, "Surfin' Bird" was on the 1977 CD, "Rocket to Russia", and "Psycho Therapy" was on the 1983 release, "Subterranean Jungle".

questions.text: Shortly before his death, Joey Ramone worked on his one and only solo album. Which of these songs was covered on that CD?
questions.explanation:
What a Wonderful World.

	Joey belted out a rendition of the Louis Armstrong classic, which was the opening track for the CD. This album was recorded while Joey was battling the cancer that took his life in 2001.

questions.text: Two days before the death of Johnny in 2004, a 30th anniversary party for the band was held in Los Angeles. Which of these bands performed at the bash?
questions.explanation:
Red Hot Chili Peppers.

	The Chili Peppers ripped through 5 tracks in 10 minutes while onstage. Although Henry Rollins, Eddie Vedder and Steve Jones performed, they did not perform with the bands that made them famous.

questions.text: Joey Ramone has a New York street sign named after him.
questions.explanation:
True.

	The sign is on the corner of Bowery and Second Street, and is located near to CBGB's, where the Ramones played many a set in the 70s.

questions.text: After the Ramones 'retired', C.J. started work on a new band, originally called the Warm Jets. What did they change the name to after that?
questions.explanation:
Bad Chopper.

	Thanks for taking this quiz. I hope it was informative, and let's hope the memory of the Ramones will continue to live on.
